1. src.exporters package¶

Exporters are responsible for interacting with different data sources and downloading data. Currently, exporters have been implemented for the current data stores:

  • The Climate Data Store
    • ERA5

      ERA5 provides hourly estimates of a large number of atmospheric, land and oceanic climate variables

    • S5

      S5 provides forecasts which are created by using computational models to calculate the evolution of the atmosphere, ocean and land surface starting from an initial state based on observations of the Earth system.

The exporters are described below.

class src.exporters.ERA5Exporter(data_folder: pathlib.Path = PosixPath('data'))¶

Bases: src.exporters.cds._CDSExporter

Exports ERA5 data from the Climate Data Store

cds.climate.copernicus.eu

Parameters

data_folder – The location of the data folder.

export(variable: str, dataset: Optional[str] = None, granularity: str = 'hourly', show_api_request: bool = True, selection_request: Optional[Dict] = None, break_up: bool = False, n_parallel_requests: int = 3) → List[pathlib.Path]¶

Export functionality to prepare the API request and to send it to the cdsapi.client() object.

Parameters

  • variable – The variable to be exported

  • dataset – The dataset from which to pull the variable from. If None, this is inferred from the variable and its granularity

  • granularity – The temporal resolution of the data to be pulled. Can be one of {‘hourly’, ‘monthly’}

  • show_api_request – Whether to print the selection dictionary before making the API request

  • selection_request – Selection request arguments to be merged with the defaults. If a key is defined in both the selection_request and the defaults, the value in the selection_request takes precedence.

  • break_up – If True, requests to the CDS API will be broken up into months.

  • n_parallel_requests – How many parallel requests to the CDSAPI to make

Returns

Paths to the downloaded data

class src.exporters.VHIExporter(data_folder: pathlib.Path = PosixPath('data'))¶

Bases: src.exporters.base._BaseExporter

Exports Vegetation Health Index from NASA site

ftp.star.nesdis.noaa.gov

Parameters

data_folder – The location of the data folder.

export(years: Optional[List] = None, repeats: int = 5, num_processes: int = 100) → List¶

Export VHI data from the ftp server.

:param yearslist of years that you want to download.

If None, all years will be downloaded

Parameters

  • repeats – The number of times to retry downloads which failed

  • num_processes – The number of processes to run. If 1, the download happens serially

Returns

list of lists containing batches of filenames downloaded

class src.exporters.ERA5ExporterPOS(data_folder: pathlib.Path = PosixPath('data'))¶

Bases: src.exporters.base._BaseExporter

Download ERA5 data from Planet OS’s S3 bucket

https://github.com/planet-os/notebooks/blob/master/aws/era5-pds.md

Parameters

data_folder – The location of the data folder.

export(variable: str, years: Optional[List[int]] = None, months: Optional[List[int]] = None) → List[pathlib.Path]¶

Export data from Planet OS’s S3 bucket

Parameters

  • variable – The variable to download

  • years – The years of data to download

  • months – The months of data to download

Returns

The locations of the saved files

class src.exporters.CHIRPSExporter(data_folder: pathlib.Path = PosixPath('data'))¶

Bases: src.exporters.base._BaseExporter

Exports precip from the Climate Hazards group site, ftp://ftp.chg.ucsb.edu/pub/org/chg/products/CHIRPS-2.0

Parameters

data_folder – The location of the data folder.

export(years: Optional[List[int]] = None, region: str = 'global', period: str = 'monthly', parallel: bool = False) → None¶

Export the CHIRPS precipitation product

Parameters

  • years – The years of data to download. If None, all data will be downloaded

  • region – One of {‘africa’, ‘global’}, the dataset region to download. If global, a netcdf file is downloaded. If africa, a tif file is downloaded

  • period – One of {‘monthly’, ‘weekly’, ‘pentad’…}, the period of the data being downloaded

  • parallel – Whether to parallelize the downloading of data

class src.exporters.S5Exporter(pressure_level: bool, granularity: str = 'monthly', data_folder: pathlib.Path = PosixPath('data'), product_type: Optional[str] = None, dataset: Optional[str] = None)¶

Bases: src.exporters.cds._CDSExporter

An exporter for S5 data from the Climate Data Store

Parameters

  • data_folder – path to the data folder (where data will be stored)

  • variable – the variable that you want to download.

  • pressure_level – Do you want data at different atmospheric heights? If True, data is downloaded from all pressure levels. If `False, only single level data is used

  • granularity – The granularity of data being pulled. ‘hourly’/’pressure_level’ data has a forecast for every 12hrs (12, 24, 36 …) ‘hourly’/’single_level’ data has a forecast for every 6hrs (6, 12, 18, 24 …) ‘monthly’ data has a forecast for every month {1 … 6}

  • product_type – The product type is only valid for monthly datasets. It corresponds to the post-processing of the monthly forecasts. If None is given, Defaults to ‘monthly_mean’. It can be one of {‘ensemble_mean’, ‘hindcast_climate_mean’, ‘monthly_mean’}. If pressure_level is False, it can additionally be {‘monthly_standard_deviation’, ‘monthly_maximum’, ‘monthly_minimum’}

  • dataset – The dataset to pull the data from. If none is passed, this is inferred from all the other information

export(variable: str, min_year: int = 1993, max_year: int = 2019, min_month: int = 1, max_month: int = 12, max_leadtime: Optional[int] = None, pressure_levels: Optional[List[int]] = None, n_parallel_requests: int = 3, show_api_request: bool = True, break_up: bool = True)¶

Export S5 data from the Climate Data Store

Parameters

  • variable – the variable that you want to download

  • min_year – The minimum year of your request

  • max_year – The maximum year of your request

  • min_month – The minimum month of your request

  • max_month – The maximum month of your request

  • max_leadtime – The maximum leadtime of your request. If granularity is hourly then provide in days. If granularity is monthly then provide in months. If None is passed, defaults to 3 months / 90 days

  • pressure_levels – Pressure levels to download data at

  • n_parallel_requests – The number of parallel requests to initialise

  • show_api_request – Whether to print the API request

  • break_up – bool: Whether to break up requests

class src.exporters.GLEAMExporter(data_folder: pathlib.Path = PosixPath('data'))¶

Bases: src.exporters.base._BaseExporter

Download data from the Global Land Evaporation Amsterdam Model (gleam.eu)

Access information can be found at gleam.eu

Parameters

data_folder – The location of the data folder.

export(variables: Union[str, List[str]], granularity: str) → None¶

Export GLEAM data

Parameters

  • variables – A string or list of string variables to download

  • granularity – The granularity of the data to download

get_granularities() → List[str]¶

Get the accepted GLEAM granularities

Returns

A list of accepted granularities
